location: Chiang Mai, จ.เชียงใหม่, Thailand
languages: English, BR. Português, Français, 普通話 and Español
about:
Ajahn Achalo was born in Australia in 1972. He developed a keen interest in meditation at the age of twenty and a year later left for Thailand to study Buddhism more intently.  After a two year period practising in various centres and monasteries, in 1996 Ajahn Achalo ordained as a Bhikkhu (monk) under Ajahn Liem at Wat Pah Pong, the monastery founded by venerable Ajahn Chah. Although most of his training has taken place in Thailand, Ajahn Achalo has also lived in several International Forest Monasteries in the Ajahn Chah lineage.  

Ajahn Achalo is deeply grateful for his many opportunities to study with well-practiced monks, as well as for having been able to train in several traditional contexts, including meditation monasteries, remote forests, and periods on pilgrimage. 

During his years of training, he has received personal guidance from many remarkable teachers, among them, Ajahn Sumedho, Ajahn Pasanno, Ajahn Jayasaro and Ajahn Kalyano. For most of his Bhikkhu life, he has considered Tan Ajahn Anan, abbot of Wat Marp Jan, to be his principal mentor. In addition, he has found the Dalai Lama's instructions and example to be of tremendous value.   

On the website all of Ajahn Achalo's Talks and Meditations have been presented in a more thorough and specialised context....read more

Since 1970, Active Meditation has brought new perspectives and techniques to meditation. It engages a new paradigm for directing consciousness in the meditative process.  An active, working relationship between our personality and Higher Self is encouraged.  Thinking is encouraged to help direct our attunement to our Higher Self (Spirit). Ajahn Dhammasiha ordained as a Buddhist monk in 1995 at Nissarana Vana, Meetirigala, Sri Lanka. His practice was guided by the original Pali scriptures, and the teachings of Ven Nyanavimala and Ven Nyanadipa.

From 1998 he lived in Forest Monasteries of the tradition of Ajahn Chah in Australia, where he received teachings by some of the foremost Thai meditation masters, like Luang Por Tui and Luang Por Plien.

Since 2007 he is the founding abbot of Dhammagiri Forest Hermitage near Brisbane....read more

Seamlessly blending his Middle Eastern heritage and Western influences to create a relaxing soundscape using guitar, live looping and multi effects pedals, Arli's latest release 'Fata Morgana' is the perfect chill-out album or accompaniment to meditation.

Having played in one of the Middle East’s first world fusion bands made up of both Palestinian and Israeli musicians, and performed everywhere from the revered stages of Montreux Jazz Festival to the desert sands of Sinai, cross-continent Wanderlust Festival appearances to Russia’s Creation of Peace Festival, the  multi-faceted guitarist and composer draws on his unique experiences to generate fearless, ambient music.

The relaxing tones are "designed to take you wherever you want to be taken to", while celebrating the diverse spectrum of the world’s vibrant melodies, harmonies and rhythms. Following on from the release of his debut self-titled album in November 2013, Fata Morgana showcases another side to Arli’s artistic spectrum, building expansive soundscapes and capturing his unique style and mesmerizing sound....read more

Anjey Satori is the author of 14 music CDs for relaxation, meditation and healing. He was born 6 April 1969 in the Ukraine and from his early years Anjey started interesting in mysticism and esoteric teaching of the East. He worked as an organizer of special courses and trainings in the Institution of Alternative Medicine where he got enough experience to start teaching basics of bio-energy and healing.

Anjey made up his pseudonym “Satori” (Enlightening in Japanese) during one of his yoga practices. Once he underwent a “consciousness expansion” and then he experienced “satori”, described in classical Zen-Buddhism. The feeling of inner light and bliss was lasting for a few days. It was an encounter with his inner Self.

His music is intended for relaxation, meditation, healing and inner travel practices.  Each piece of music creates a harmonious balance of music and spirituality.

Anjey Satori studied bioenergetics, dowsing and healing. He successfully completed a course of White Magic by Raokriom and practical seminar of holodynamics by Vernon Woolf. Anjey also studied Osho and method of Tao master Mantak Chia. Anjey is a pupil of Maha Yogi Pilot Baba. Practicing Yoga, Qigong and Tao-alchemy.

From 1992 to 1993 Anjey worked as a correspondent of the “Ekstrasens” newspaper. From 1994 to 1997 he was a head of School of Correspondence Tuition of Psychic at the Kiev Institute of Alternative Medicine. Anjey developed a method for teaching of psychics. More than 2000 people successfully completed the school. Many of Anjey’s students show very good results in clairvoyance and extrasensory perception skills and healing practice.

From 1998 to 1999 Anjey was organizing trainings in the Academy of Popular Healing.

Currently Anjey is a producer and publisher music for relaxation and meditation, healing and esoteric music....read more
